caption: A replica of the Golden Flame, held aloft by the Statue of Liberty, built by Gustave Eiffel in New York. It was erected here in 1989 to mark the centenary of the original work and the link between the two countries. It is widely mistaken as a memorial to the late Princess Diana who died in the underpass below the flame.

Visiting the Flame of Liberty in Paris was a moving experience. It was surreal to be in such an iconic place. It made my visit to Paris even more memorable. The monument itself is striking. I am so grateful to have witnessed it in person. Definitely visit if you can. I am happy to share this with you.

Monument now unofficially dedicated to late Princess Diana, who died in a car crash in 1997 in Paris. Originally it was symbol of Franco-American friendship offered in 1989 to Paris by donors throughout world.

The Flame of Liberty is a little-known but unique attraction in Paris that visitors might enjoy. Located at the northern end of the Pont de l'Alma bridge, the Flame of Liberty is a replica of the torch from the Statue of Liberty in New York City. Here are some little-known special attractions about the Flame of Liberty: The flame has become a symbol of Franco-American friendship since it was gifted to France in 1987 by the International Herald Tribune, a newspaper based in Paris with strong ties to the United States. The Flame of Liberty became an impromptu memorial site for Princess Diana after her tragic death in 1997. The flame is located just above the entrance to the tunnel where the accident occurred, and people continue to leave flowers and notes in tribute to her. The flame has been used as a backdrop for several high-profile events and photoshoots, including fashion campaigns for Dior and Louis Vuitton, and music videos for Beyonc√© and Jay-Z. Visitors can climb a nearby staircase to get a closer view of the flame, as well as stunning views of the Seine River and the Eiffel Tower. The Flame of Liberty is located in a quiet and peaceful area of Paris, away from the crowds of more popular attractions. It's a great spot to take a leisurely stroll and enjoy the scenic views of the city

This statue is looked at the end of Pont de l'Alma bridge near Av. de New York.  The Flame of Liberty in Paris is a full-sized, gold-leaf-covered replica of the flame of the torch from the Statue of Liberty. The monument, which measures approximately 3.5 meters in height, is a sculpture of a flame, executed in gilded copper, supported by a pedestal of gray-and-black marble.  The Flame of Liberty became an unofficial memorial for Diana, Princess of Wales, after her 1997 death in the tunnel beneath the Pont de l'Alma.  The flame has become an attraction for tourists and followers of Diana, who fly-posted the base with commemorative material. Since 2019, the site has been officially named Place Diana.

Nice visit in a splendid location.Visit while walking to he Eiffel tower. The place also hosts the memorial for Princess Diana, who's car crashed in the tunnel below, leasing to her tragic death. The flame is a true size replica and situated in a photogenic spot.
